thread.title: India vs South Africa 5th ODI Preview: IND, SA to fight it out in series-decider
thread.title_full: India vs South Africa 5th ODI Preview: IND, SA to fight it out in series-decider

author: Aayush Puthran | India.com Sports Desk
title: India vs South Africa 5th ODI Preview: IND, SA to fight it out in series-decider
text:
India vs South Africa 5th ODI Preview: IND, SA to fight it out in series-decider By India.com Sports Desk on October 24, 2015 at 11:00 PM Comments With the series levelled at 2-2, India and South Africa take on each other in the fifth One-Day International (ODI) at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai on Sunday in the Paytm Freedom series decider. For the first time on this tour, South Africa were outclassed with both bat and ball by the hosts at Chennai. (Also Read: India vs South Africa 5 th ODI – Top 5 Players to Watch Out For ) Virat Kohli’s return to form will be a huge boost for the Indians. The Delhi batsman had gone through his longest phase without a half-century before scoring a fifty and hundred in consecutive matches. However, he is still far away from his best. His knocks in Rajkot and Chennai were fluent, but didn’t go at the pace in which he would’ve liked. Given India’s misery in the death overs, Kohli would extend his innings till the very end. However, it has been Indian spinners who have caused the most grief to the South African batsmen. Despite getting off to good starts in every match, the Proteas batsmen fail to play the Indian spinners well. They lose wickets and find it tough to get the scoreboard moving. Barring AB de Villiers and JP Duminy, none of their batsmen have countered Indian spinners well. South Africa Squad: Hashim Amla, Quinton de Kock(w), Faf du Plessis, AB de Villiers(c), David Miller, Farhaan Behardien, Chris Morris, Aaron Phangiso, Dale Steyn, Kagiso Rabada, Imran Tahir, Kyle Abbott, Dean Elgar, Khaya Zondo, Morne Morkel India Squad: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Ajinkya Rahane, Suresh Raina, MS Dhoni(w/c), Axar Patel, Harbhajan Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Amit Mishra, Mohit Sharma, Ambati Rayudu, Stuart Binny, Gurkeerat Singh Mann, Sreenath Aravind
